A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This would be a fine movie if it was the first and only Star Wars film. But as part of a larger canon\, this film is a huge disappointment. First\, enough with the forced diversity. The three young heroes are a white female\, a black male\, and an asian female. And the villain is a white male. A little obvious\, no? That's a level of pandering that's just embarrassing and inauthentic. Second\, that's not Luke Skywalker. He was a hero and source of hope (A New Hope\, in fact) for people who wanted to be inspired. You killed our hope. Third\, way to throw away a potentially great villain in Snoke. Rian Johnson cared more about being different as a director than he did about the story and IP he was working with. When you direct a Star Wars story\, it's not about you. It's about something bigger than you. Something that millions of people love and respect. This was a failure in that regard. On a positive note\, it was well shot.
